page.title: 12Longdon Village Hall
page.content: This {belongs to the village}and was built in 1939. It is organised by a 19 member {management committee, }which includes a {representative} from each {club}who uses the hall. Over the past year new curtains have been hung, the electrical installation re-wired and the hall re-painted and decorated. It is {heated}by electric wall heaters and has {refreshment {facilities,} with water heated by an electric geyser. The floor is{polished {hardwood} and is very suitable for {dancing.}There is also a{stage. Apart from general fund - raising activities, there is a "100 Club", the members paying Â£2 for each of 6 draws per year. A percentage goes in prize money, the remainder to the funds. It is the{ only meeting place }in the village, there being no church or school hall.
